article.name: Protect - User Guide (COM Add-In)
article.title: Protect - User Guide (COM Add-In)
article.body:
Protect is encryption software that allows you to control and protect the information and data that you send. Protect integrates seamlessly into your Microsoft Outlook account. If Microsoft Outlook is not available, you can use Protect functionality using Web Access.

Note:The information in this guide is the default configuration of Protect. Your experience may vary depending on your organization’s configuration choices.

Encryption

Protect integrates with your Microsoft Outlook and allows you to control and protect the information and data that you send.

When composing a new email, an Unclassified button is displayed. This allows you to select the appropriate level of email security for the email you compose.

When selecting the Unclassified button, the following encryption options are available by default:

Large File Transfer

When composing a new email, an Attach Large Files button is displayed. Selecting Attach Large Files opens a side panel. Here, you can drag and drop or browse and select files to attach.

Note:

  • By default, files greater than 10MB will be attached using LFT (this threshold is customizable and may be greater than 10MB). The side panel opens automatically to display the attachments.
  • The recommended maximum file size for large file transfer is 2GB.

images.alt:
The image displays three distinct security configuration options, likely representing message protection levels within an email or communications interface. Each option is presented with an icon, a bold title, and a detailed description.

1.  **Unprotected:**
    *   **Icon:** A dark grey/purple unlocked padlock.
    *   **Description:** "Select this option for non sensitive information. Email message will not be encrypted." This option maintains unencrypted message transmission.

2.  **Encrypt:**
    *   **Icon:** A pink/magenta locked padlock.
    *   **Description:** "Select this option to encrypt email message text and attachments." This option mandates standard encryption for all message components.

3.  **Encrypt - One Click Access:**
    *   **Icon:** A pink/magenta key within a rectangular outline (keyhole graphic).
    *   **Description:** "Select this option to encrypt email message text and attachments. Recipients of the email will not be required to authenticate to access it." This option applies encryption while bypassing recipient authentication for convenience.
images.context: trong>Unclassified button, the following encryption options are available by default:

images.alt:
A white dialog box or panel, visually originating from a "Large File Attachment" icon in a sidebar, is displayed over a dark blue background.

**Sidebar Element (Partially visible on the left):**
*   **Icon:** An orange paperclip icon.
*   **Label:** "Attach Large Files" (stacked text).

**Main Dialog Box (Overlay):**
*   **Title:** "Attach Large Files," accompanied by a dark paperclip icon (attachment symbol).
*   **Context Area:** A main area bordered by a light grey dashed line, intended for file input.
*   **Instructions:** Centered text provides two methods for file selection:
    1.  "Drag and drop files here to attach"
    2.  The coordinating conjunction "or"
*   **Action Button:** A rectangular button with a dark blue background and white, bold text: "Select Files." This button facilitates opening a standard file browser.
images.context: Here, you can drag and drop or browse and select files to attach.
